text_en: The cane is an extension of the arm and the index finger has to point down on the cane. A person with visually impairment (PWVI) will then be aware of different surfaces and obstacles.

Let the angle of the cane be around 45 degrees toward the surface. The main techniques are constant contact and touch technique. When using constant contact the cane has contact with the surface all the time and swing from side to side. This technique allow the PWVI to be aware of obstacles in front of her/him before she/he reach them.
Use trail technique when walking along a house. Let the cane follow the wall. Use the thumb to support the cane. Then the PWVI know when she/he has reached the end of the house.
When going up or down stairs, handle the cane vertically. The PWVI should have the cane in front of her/him and measure the height of the next step.
Find the door handle? Hold the cane vertically and move it horisontally. Then The PWVI will find the door handle with ease.
